content.description:
The hardest route at the cliff. 5 bolts of relentless power endurance moves leads to a good rest on a deep incut ledge, and then easier, but still engaging face climbing to the anchors. A must do for the cliff if you are up for a technical power endurance testpiece.Â 

From the central chossy sector of the wall (lookers right of duelling banjos area), it is the second from the left. One of the first routes you come across when approaching from the parking lot.
7 bolts, two bolt anchor at the top.

Steep, sustained and very fingery describe very well the climbs for this area.   This wall hosts the highest concentration of hard climbs at Spillimacheen.   The majority of the climbs tackle vertical faces on small holds, however the right-hand side has a change in scene with a sloper problem. 
  
 In the summer months the heat can make these extra desperate.
